title: on it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 1. The Physiotherapists Registration Board Approved Qualifications ByeLaw 2018 (S.I. No. 205 of 2018) is hereby revoked with effect from the date
text_raw:
1. The Physiotherapists Registration Board Approved Qualifications ByeLaw 2018 (S.I. No. 205 of 2018) is hereby revoked with effect from the date 
specified in paragraph (2.(2)), without prejudice to any applications for 
registration or restoration received by the board prior to that date.
text_norm: 1 physiotherapist registration board approved qualification byelaw 2018 (s.i no 205 2018) hereby revoked effect date specified paragraph (2.(2)) without prejudice application registration restoration received board prior date

title: on it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: (1) The bye-law may be cited as the Physiotherapists Registration
text_raw:
2. 

(1) The bye-law may be cited as the Physiotherapists Registration 

Board Approved Qualifications Bye-Law 2020. 

(2) The bye-law comes into operation on 27 May 2020.
text_norm: 2 (1) bye-law may cited physiotherapist registration board approved qualification bye-law 2020 (2) bye-law come operation 27 may 2020

title: on it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: In the bye-law –
text_raw:
3. 

In the bye-law – 

“the Act” means the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 
(no.27 of 2005) (as amended from time to time); 

“the Register” means the register of the Physiotherapists Registration 
Board established under section 36(1)(a) of the Act.
text_norm: 3 bye-law - act mean health social care professional act 2005 (no.27 2005) (as amended time time) register mean register physiotherapist registration board established section 36(1)(a) act

title: on it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: 4. The Physiotherapists Registration Board, for the purposes of Section
text_raw:
4. The Physiotherapists Registration Board, for the purposes of Section 
38(2)(a) of the Act, hereby approves the following qualifications as attesting to 
the standard of proficiency required for registration in the Register: 

(1) Bachelor of Science in Physiotherapy, University of Limerick; 

(2) Master of Science in Physiotherapy (Professional Qualification), 

University of Limerick; 

(3) Honours Degree of Bachelor of Science in Physiotherapy, National 

University of Ireland, Royal College of Surgeons in Ireland; 

(4) Master of Science Physiotherapy (pre-registration), National University 

of Ireland, University College Dublin; 

(5) Honours Degree Bachelor of Science (Physiotherapy), National 

University of Ireland, University College Dublin; 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 29th May, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [187] 3 

(6) Professional Master of Physiotherapy, National University of Ireland, 

University College Dublin 

(7) Bachelor in Science in Physiotherapy (BSc (Physio)) from the 
University of Dublin awarded to graduates on successful completion of the 
four year pathway/programme to this award. 

(8) Master of Science in Physiotherapy, University College Cork 

Given under the Seal of the Physiotherapists Registration Board 
 27 May 2020 

NIAMH MURPHY, 
 Chairperson, Physiotherapists Registration Board 

JENNY BRANIGAN 
 Member, Physiotherapists Registration Board 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [187]

title: on it by section 31 of the Health and Social Care Professionals Act 2005 (as
heading: (This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

This bye-law identifies the qualifications awarded in the State which are 
approved by the Physiotherapists Registration Board as attesting to the 
standard of proficiency required for registration with the Physiotherapists 
Registration Board. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [187] 5
